remarks: Define the class of atomic lattices, in which every nonzero element is greater than or equal to an atom.  We also ensure the existence of a lattice zero, since a lattice by itself may not have a zero. (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2011.)  (Revised by NM, 14-Sep-2018.)
statement:
df-atl $p |- AtLat = { k e. Lat | ( ( Base ` k ) e. dom ( glb ` k ) /\ A. x e. ( Base ` k ) ( x =/= ( 0. ` k ) -> E. p e. ( Atoms ` k ) p ( le ` k ) x ) ) } $.
$d k p x $.
